page.title: 07WOODINGDEAN AND ADULTS' WORK
page.content: One hundred and twenty five pupils of Woodingdean Middle School were asked about the working habits of the adults in their households.These adults were defined as anyone who had left permanent education.The larger number of workers leave Woodingdean for their job,and a small percentage only, do not go to work. Forty nine adults work in Woodingdean. One hundred and eight adults work out of Woodingdean. Thirty two adults do not work. Most people travel to the centre of Brighton to work,whilst others travel to Lewes,Crawley,Gatwick Airport or London. One child's father works in Stoke on Trent and returns home for three days in each fortnight.
